<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Stumbling Feint](/Feats.aspx?ID=1744) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 129 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 8)

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5); [Stumbling Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=1735)

**Requirements**
You are in Stumbling Stance.

</column>

---

You lash out confusingly with what seems to be a weak move but instead allows you to unleash a dangerous flurry of blows upon your unsuspecting foe. When you use [Flurry of Blows](/Actions.aspx?ID=9), you can attempt a check to [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48) as a free action just before the first Strike. On a success, instead of making the target [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against your next attack, they become flat-footed against both attacks from the Flurry of Blows.
name: Stumbling Feint
